meanings.definition: A form or process of civil government or constitution.
meanings.sent1: In our small town, the local polity is based on direct democracy.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Greek polity was known for its emphasis on citizen participation.
meanings.sent3: The polity of the neighborhood watch group made decisions by drawing straws.
meanings.sent4: The polity of the student council mirrored that of a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The polity of the bee colony was a fascinating example of organized cooperation.

meanings.definition: A particular form or system of government.
meanings.sent1: The tribal polity relied on elders to make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The feudal polity was characterized by a strict hierarchy.
meanings.sent3: The polity of the penguin colony involved a comical system of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: The polity of the ant colony was like a bustling city with its own rules.
meanings.sent5: The polity of the wolf pack was a model of efficient leadership and teamwork.
